long_description:
Easter has become synonym of chocolate bunnies, colored eggs baskets, scavenger hunts and brunches. When you’re in a popular city like New York, these events abound… And crowds triple. But we know that you, a seasoned Royalton New York guest, are always seeking unique experiences in the Big Apple. Allow us to make a few suggestions for Easter Sunday, which falls on April 1st this year.

 

Brunch or Dinner on a Cruise

You want to keep the tradition of having a special meal on Easter but would rather avoid overcrowded streets and restaurants? We hear you. Instead, take to the water by booking a cruise with Spirit Cruises. You have two choices:

Bateaux New York Easter Cruises: This is the best option for adults in search of a sophisticated and luxurious alternative.

  • Brunch with a live trio, freshly prepared menu and bottomless mimosas.

  • Dinner with amazing night views of Manhattan, a live trio and a special dinner menu.

Easter Aboard Spirit: Great for families  looking for a fun and laid-back atmosphere.

  • Buffet brunch during a 2-hour cruise, with DJ, games and the Easter Bunny.

  • Buffet dinner during a 2.5-hour cruise, with DJ and interactive games.

 

Chocolate-Making Class

No matter how old you are, Easter isn’t the same without chocolate. Try a new take on chocolate-binging and make your own gourmet delicacies. Tache Artisan Chocolate is a chocolaterie located in Lower East Side that prides itself in creating handmade chocolate. Each class consists of the entire chocolate-making process, from tempering to decorating. You’ll take home everything you make - go bold and create your own treat!

Play or Concert in Lincoln Center

Get your culture fix by attending a play or concert at Lincoln Center. On April 1st, you’ll have the option of: Esto-Atlantis Choral Concert, Estonian sacred choral music; The DIVA Jazz Orchestra's 25th Anniversary Celebration and CD Release Party; Admissions, a play about the ideals and contradictions of white liberalism in the United States; and the acclaimed musical Lerner & Loewe's My Fair Lady.

Finish off a great day with a drink at Bar 44 or just enjoy the modern amenities and plump pillows of your room at the Royalton New York.
